content:
Hi
We are creating a repository which we want to have a structure like this:

repo/
  lean-part/
  other-part1/
  other-part2/
  ፧

The other-parts are thing in other languages
The thing is: For the lean-part we want to run continuos integration to test everything
When creating the lean project, it creates a workflow file:

name: Lean Action CI

on:
  push:
  pull_request:
  workflow_dispatch:

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest

    steps:
      - uses: actions/checkout@v4
      - uses: leanprover/lean-action@v1

But this file works for when the Lean project is in it own repo, and I'm not being able to make it work for when the Lean project is in a sub-folder of a repo
Does somebody know how to make it work? Or do you know about some repo that has done that?
Does setting the lake-package-directory config option work? See the lean-action README.
Iván Renison has marked this topic as resolved.
